alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 1:47PM EDT until May 19 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK AND NORTHWESTERN NEW HANOVER COUNTIES... At 147 PM EDT, Emergency management reported lingering flooding with some roads still closed in Leland. Additional flash flooding still possible elsewhere in the warning area, especially in low-lying and poorly drained areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may still experience flash flooding include... Wilmington, Leland, Bishop, Hightsville, Phoenix, Town Creek, Winnabow, Silver Lake, Wrightsboro, Wilmington International Airport, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Kings Grant, Murrayville, Ogden, Belville, Navassa and New Hanover Regional Medical Center. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause dangerous flooding, especially near creeks and streams, drainage ditches, and low-lying flood prone areas. Turn around, don`t drown if you encounter a flooded road. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from storm drains, culverts, creeks, and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep you away.
